intro: Melanoseris sichuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan Melanoseris, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
